docs.lead_paragraph: Teaching people memorization strategies that can encourage the brain to work more effectively may help reduce the memory loss that often accompanies aging, researchers say. Writing in the current issue of Neuron, researchers said that volunteers given memorization tips -- somewhat like those a sales agent uses to remember customers' names -- could be seen using their brains differently on functional magnetic resonance imaging scans.

headline.main: Bench Presses for Older People's Brains

docs.abstract: Researchers, in study published in current issue of Neuron, find that teaching people memorization tips that can encourage brain to work more effectively may help reduce memory loss often associated with aging; drawing (M)
